p: Six rhesus macaques ( Macaca mulatta) were infected with 5 x 10 5 pfu s.c. of DENV-2 New Guinea 44 in 2016 (cohort 1 in Fig 1). In 2017, four rhesus macaques were infected with the same virus strain and pfu (cohort 2 in Fig 1). In addition, a control group, composed by six flavivirus-naïve rhesus macaques was added (cohort 3 in Fig 1). All three cohorts were infected with 1 x 10 6 pfu s.c. ZIKV PRVABC59 on the same day, defining exposure time between infections for cohorts 1 and 2 as 12 months or middle convalescent and 3 months or early convalescent, respectively ( Fig 1). Prior to the challenge with ZIKV, all sixteen animals were put through a quarantine period of forty days. Fig 1 also denotes the unexpected setback that Hurricane María brought to our work plan. Sample collection programmed from days 7 to 29 p.i. was interrupted due to inability of access and/or lack of power at the CPRC facilities, University of Puerto Rico, San Juan, Puerto Rico.
